intro: Trachelioides vulgaris, commonly known as the common trachelioides, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and compound umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and is known for its aromatic foliage. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers are small and white or greenish in color. Trachelioides vulgaris is often used in herbal medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
